message: Guys any helpful resources for learning the MEAN stack? can be lectures, videos or even project tutorials. Thanks

data.message: جوجل صديقك طيب سألته ولا لأ؟

I don't wanna discourage you but if you Google "learn mean stack" you will get hundreds of resources ... Thinkster.io even have a list ... There is a popular github repo containing huge list of resources ...
There are quora questions, stackoverflow posts, reddit posts ... there are literally hundreds of resources available for free ...

My own recommendations is to learn each one separately and then get any tutorial to show you how to get proper project structure. In udemy.com I recommend two courses as beginning, "learn and understand nodejs" & "learn and understand angular" both are very powerful and I recommend them personally over many other tutorial I found, both are focusing on understanding the technique and big words. Inside node course you will found intro to express and mongo. 
For express and mongo tutorial I didn't try to look for them but I'm pretty sure you can find your way.

You can register on the official course in MongoDB university for free MONGODB FOR NODE.JS DEVELOPERS
https://university.mongodb.com/courses/M101JS/about
then go to lynda courses like this 
http://www.lynda.com/Express.js-tutorials/Developing-MEAN-Stack-MongoDB/191940-2.html
